answers.answer: Yeah, I agree there’s not too much you can do to change your blood glucose results if you were fasting already. Aside from introducing meds, that is.Keep in mind that things like white bread, most pasta, potatoes, things like that tend to elevate blood sugar quickly. In place of those, consider whole grains and sweet potatoes/yams. And of course, sugar and hidden sugar/corns syrups etc.Fasting sugar should be 125 mg/dL. Non of these values mean much with one test, but if repeated tests show problems, it’s time to address this.I was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes in 2003; it’s not something you want to deal with if it can be avoided. Plus, insulin resistance can be a negative factor for managing HCV/achieving SVR. It can be done, but it makes it more difficult.Be sure to discuss these results with your primary care doctor, and take whatever steps are needed to nip this in the bud. Are you overweight? Any history of diabetes in the family?Good luck with the immediate results; I hope they accept you to the trial—Bill
